Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates or cultist wearing festival wreath headdress. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. White (gypsum?) coating. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably made in Naukratis. A similar example in the British Museum, said to be from the Fayum, is dated to the 2nd and 1st century BC (Bailey 2008, no.3186).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.065) (Phase 1)
